description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens.
author: George Orwell

title: Animal Farm
description: A satirical tale about a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer, only to face a new tyranny among themselves.
author: George Orwell

title: The Electric State
description: A graphic novel set in an alternate 1997, following a girl and her robot in a crumbling tech-driven world.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
description: An aging Cuban fisherman struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.
author: Ernest Hemingway

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the Deep South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.
author: Harper Lee

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic society engineered for conformity and happiness at the cost of individuality.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A dystopian future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A story about teenage alienation and rebellion as told by Holden Caulfield.
author: J.D. Salinger
